questions.Q: The diagram shows a sketch of part of the curve with equation $$y=x(x-3)$$ and the line with equation $$y=2x$$. The area of the shaded region $$OAC$$ is:
questions.E: Shaded area = Area of triangle $$OBC-\int_{a}^{b} x(x-3) \,dx \\$$ The curve cuts the x-axis at $$x=3$$ and $$x=0\text{,}$$ so $$a=3\\$$The curve intercepts the line when $$\\2x=x(x-3)\\ \therefore\, x=0$$ or $$x=5$$ so $$b=5\\$$ The point $$C$$ is $$(5,10)\\$$ Area of triangle $$OBC=\frac{1}{2}\times 5\times 10 =25\\$$Area between curve, x-axis and the line $$x=5$$ is: $$\\ \int_{3}^{5} x(x-3) \,dx=\int_{3}^{5} (x^2-3x) \,dx= \Big[\frac{x^3}{3}-3\frac{x^2}{2}\Big]_{3}^5=\Big(\frac{125}{3}-\frac{75}{2}\Big)-\Big(\frac{27}{3}+\frac{27}{2}\Big)=\Big(\frac{25}{6}\Big)-\Big(-\frac{27}{6}\Big)=\frac{26}{3}\\ $$Thus, shaded area is: $$25-\frac{26}{3}=\frac{49}{3}$$

The diagram shows a sketch of part of the curve with equation $$y=\frac{2}{x^2}+x\,\text{.}$$ The points $$A$$ and $$B$$ have x-coordinates $$\frac{1}{2}$$ and $$2$$ respectively. The area of the shaded region between $$AB$$ and the curve is:
questions.E: Coordinates of points $$A$$ and $$B$$ are $$\\A(\frac{1}{2},y(\frac{1}{2}))=A(\frac{1}{2},\frac{2}{(\frac{1}{2})^2}+\frac{1}{2})=A(\frac{1}{2},\frac{17}{2})\\ B(2,y(2))=B(2,\frac{2}{2^2}+2)=B(2,\frac{5}{2})\\$$ The gradient of the line passing through points $$A$$ and $$B$$ is $$\\m=\frac{\frac{17}{2}-\frac{5}{2}}{\frac{1}{2}-2}=-4\\$$ and the equation of the line passing through the same points is: $$\\ y=-4x+\frac{21}{2}\\$$ The shaded area is $$\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^2(f(x)-g(x)) \,dx\\$$ where $$f(x)=-4x+\frac{21}{2}$$ and $$g(x)=\frac{1}{x^2}+x\text{.}\\$$ Thus, shaded area is $$\\ \int_{\frac{1}{2}}^2[(-4x+\frac{21}{2})-(\frac{2}{x^2}+x)] \,dx=\int_{\frac{1}{2}}^2[-3x -\frac{2}{x^2}+\frac{21}{2}] \,dx=\Big[ -\frac{3}{2}x^2 +\frac{2}{x}+\frac{21}{2}x \Big]_{\frac{1}{2}}^2=\frac{57}{8}$$
